definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]

sentences.english: Chess, game, the player using these pieces go first son.
sentences.chinese: 圍棋，對局時，執黑子的先走。

sentences.english: How is this year's Sino-Japan Chess Challenge Tournament going on?
sentences.chinese: 今年的中日圍棋擂臺賽進行得如何？

sentences.english: The rules of Weiqi are very simple but there are countless variations of strategies.
sentences.chinese: 圍棋的規則很簡單，但是有數不盡的策略。

sentences.english: Weiqi (Go chess) is the oldest game in the world.
sentences.chinese: 圍棋是世界上最古老的棋類遊戲。

sentences.english: As the go players have entered the deciding stage, the results should come out soon.
sentences.chinese: 圍棋大師賽進入了封盤的關鍵階段，勝負即將決出。

sentences.english: "Goe" is a ballet of complementary patterns intertwining across the board.
sentences.chinese: 圍棋，是一種交織在棋盤上的黑白圖案形成的芭蕾。

sentences.english: The same is true for Go. %26quot;
sentences.chinese: 讓電腦下圍棋也是一樣。

sentences.english: As result, Park Shiun has become the third ninth-dan women Weiqi player in the world.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，樸志恩已成爲世界上第三位女子圍棋九段。

sentences.english: "We used to offer only weiqi and Chinese chess in our club, " says Wang.
sentences.chinese: “以前，我們社團裏只有圍棋和象棋，”王峯說。

sentences.english: My grandfather likes to play checkers .
Finally, we apply ConceptNet in our Computer Go engines.
sentences.chinese: 最後，實現了概念網在計算機圍棋引擎中的應用。

sentences.english: On the other hand, Qi is the basics of existence in Weiqi.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，在圍棋中，“氣”更是其生存之本。

sentences.english: Chinese go provides the origin for the design inspiration of this set of teapot.
sentences.chinese: 這套茶壺設計靈感來自中國的圍棋。

sentences.english: In Go, however, beginning to program and making progress are both very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在圍棋中，開局和行棋都非常困難。

sentences.english: My son looks as though he's going to take after me, because he's started go already.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子看來好像要跟上我了，因爲他已經開始下圍棋。

definition: in one's spare time/outside working hours/amateur (historian etc)

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
